New Records: Evin Lewis scored his third ODI century against Sri Lanka and his first in the format since March 2021.
Key Match Events: Evin Lewis scored 102 not out off 61 balls.
Sherfane Rutherford scored 50 not out off 26 balls.
West Indies won by eight wickets via the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) Method.
Kusal Mendis scored 56 not out off 22 balls for Sri Lanka.
Pathum Nissanka scored 56 off 62 balls for Sri Lanka.
Evin Lewis and Sherfane Rutherford shared an unbeaten 88-run stand for the third wicket.
Evin Lewis hit nine fours and four sixes.
Sherfane Rutherford hit four fours and three sixes.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Daren Sammy hopes the momentum from this win can be transferred to the upcoming white-ball series against England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was reduced to a 23-over affair after a five-hour rain stoppage.
West Indies needed 56 runs off the last five overs.
Evin Lewis was struggling with an apparent ankle injury but managed to score his century.
